summary: Quali film arriverà al cinema dopo Avengers: Endgame?
title: Quali film arriverà al cinema dopo Avengers: Endgame?
body:
Quali film arriverà al cinema dopo Avengers: Endgame?

Con l’approdo di Captain Marvel al cinema, ed il conto alla rovescia per Avengers: Endgame partito, i fan Marvel si chiedono quali saranno i piani futuri per il MCU.

Spider-Man: Far From Here a parte, il futuro post-Avengers: Endgame risulta ancora un mistero, e questo nonostante le voci che da mesi si susseguono sui potenziali nuovi capitoli scelti per il Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Kevin…

summary: Deadpool invade il secondo trailer di Avengers: Endgame
title: Deadpool invade il secondo trailer di Avengers: Endgame
body:
Deadpool invade il secondo trailer di Avengers: Endgame

Molto presto gli X-Men e I Fantastici 4 potranno essere “assemblati” nel Marvel Cinematic Universe, ma nel frattempo c’è chi non ha proprio voglia di aspettare.

Attraverso un divertente lavoro grafico da parte di un fan molto creativo, l’irriverente Deadpool ha scelto di “invadere” letteralmente il secondo trailer di Avengers: Endgameappena rilasciato. Ed il risultato è assolutamente…

summary: Look if Endgame doesn’t deliver on the Steve/Carol friendship then frankly, what is the point? Why was the MCU created? Why were...
body: Look if Endgame doesn’t deliver on the Steve/Carol friendship then frankly, what is the point? Why was the MCU created? Why were the Marvel comics written? Why was I born? Why did we advance far enough as a species to create cinematic universes if this specific cinematic universe doesn’t give us a Steve and Carol friendship?

reblog.comment: Look if Endgame doesn’t deliver on the Steve/Carol friendship then frankly, what is the point? Why was the MCU created? Why were the Marvel comics written? Why was I born? Why did we advance far enough as a species to create cinematic universes if this specific cinematic universe doesn’t give us a Steve and Carol friendship?

trail.content_raw: Look if Endgame doesn’t deliver on the Steve/Carol friendship then frankly, what is the point? Why was the MCU created? Why were the Marvel comics written? Why was I born? Why did we advance far enough as a species to create cinematic universes if this specific cinematic universe doesn’t give us a Steve and Carol friendship?
trail.content: Look if Endgame doesn’t deliver on the Steve/Carol friendship then frankly, what is the point? Why was the MCU created? Why were the Marvel comics written? Why was I born? Why did we advance far enough as a species to create cinematic universes if this specific cinematic universe doesn’t give us a Steve and Carol friendship?

blog.name: miragerules
blog.description:
My blog doesn't follow any one particular fandom or ship, but my favorite shows are Person of Interest, 12 Monkeys, Arrow, Black Sails, The Expanse, Daredevil, Game of Thrones, Jessica Jones, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Agent Carter, and The 100 to name a few.      


Some of the ships I am a huge fan of and follow are Brutasha (Bruce Banner/Natasha Romanoff), Olicity (Oliver Queen/Felicity Smoke), Shoot (Root/Shaw), Skoulson (Phil Coulson/Daisy Johnson), and Liason  (Jason Morgan/Elizabeth Webber) to name a few.

summary: “Every journey begins on a high note. We stumble upon the low tides as well. But eventually we do pick ourselves up. Life takes...
body:
“Every journey begins on a high note. We stumble upon the low tides as well. But eventually we do pick ourselves up. Life takes things away from you. But eventually we do gain them back. Every thing has an end. Every object, every life, it all is meant to be perished. And that isn’t something that we should be afraid of. Death isn’t supposed to bring mourning. But on the contrary, it’s a celebration of the achievements, of the moments, of the lowest tides, & the highest notes, because part of this journey… is the end.”

Art by @ultraraw26 |IG|

summary:
”Not everyone has faith in themselves. 
Having people, individuals, that care for you, that you could count on, is a luxury in...
body:
”Not everyone has faith in themselves.

Having people, individuals, that care for you, that you could count on, is a luxury in itself. Anyone can achieve strength, but the achievement of someone’s undying support can change the face of reality. It can make the impossible into possible.

It could turn a stick into a cannon.

If you have faith in yourself, in your actions, or in the people around you, then no matter how many lines are drawn against you, then you are able to survive all the way, till the end of the line.”

Art by @ultraraw26 |IG|

summary: Marvel really thought Infinity War was done so well that it would get all their fans desperate and hyped to see things possibly...
body:
Marvel really thought Infinity War was done so well that it would get all their fans desperate and hyped to see things possibly get better in End Game, and not that it was so boring and dumb in plot and so depressing as fuck in it’s ending, that it would make a good amount of their loyal fans just not be interested in End Game. Were there funny moments in Infinity War? Yeah. Was the plot written by a first year economics major with an intro level understanding of supply and demand, and did it depend on we as the audience caring about Vision enough to not want to sacrifice him to protect the world? Did it kill off so many of our favorites for no good reason? Also yeah.

I’m curious at best for End Game. But am I invested? Am I going to support it on opening weekend? Do I genuinely care about it? Not at all.

summary: Valerie, Angela and Tatiana have plenty of Marvel and Disney news to discuss, such as: Shang-Chi finding a director (1:30), the...
caption:
Valerie, Angela and Tatiana have plenty of Marvel and Disney news to discuss, such as: Shang-Chi finding a director (1:30), the latest Avengers: Endgame trailer (11:40), and the first full-length Aladdin trailer (24:40). Then we move on to the rest of the news, including: The Flash getting a new showrunner (31:20), One Day At A Time getting unfairly cancelled (39:00), and the upsetting Burning Sun case in South Korea (45:50).

You can let us know your thoughts in the comments below, or on our Podomatic page here.

summary: 'Avengers: EndGame': Mark Ruffalo missing his Hulk costume
title: 'Avengers: EndGame': Mark Ruffalo missing his Hulk costume
excerpt: It seems like Mark Ruffalo didn't get the memo. The 'Avengers' actor didn't even give time for fans to speculate the reason behind him not being portrayed as his superhero alter ego Hulk in the 'Avengers: EndGame' poster, before pointing it out himself with the help of a hilarious meme.

blog.name: fromshiptocanon
blog.title: limerence
blog.description: (n)the state of being infatuated with another person//kass//multifandom & shitposts

summary: i think that, while we all say like “oh steve is so old ahaha,” we forget that when he went into that ice, we really wasn’t that...
body: i think that, while we all say like “oh steve is so old ahaha,” we forget that when he went into that ice, we really wasn’t that old. he was 21 when he sacrificed himself in order to stop hydra. and when he came out of that ice, he still had the mind of a 21 year old man, despite having to be more mature because of WWII. so, suddenly, he’s in this world where he’s no longer allowed to be his age. he’s a leader, a role model. but in his mind, he still that kid from brooklyn. and honestly, my heart kinda breaks for him.

summary: InnerCityGeeks Podcast: Episode 150 - Moving On Up To The 3rd Floor
title: InnerCityGeeks Podcast: Episode 150 - Moving On Up To The 3rd Floor
body:
Check out the latest episode of @InnerCityGeeks #Podcast! Episode 150 - Moving On Up To The 3rd Floor is available now on SoundCloud, Stitcher, Google Play Music and Spotify!

This week our geeks talk about Captain Marvel, Wonder Park, the new trailer for Avengers: Endgame, James Gunn coming back to do Guardians 3, the cancellation of One Day At A Time on Netflix and so much more.

This episode also features music from Hyro The Hero – “Never Back Down”.

Check out seosicclothing.co and enter promo code innercitygeeks at check out for 15% off!

Listen to this episode on So…
